Content: New Year  New HQ  New sign

Nowhere worth going you can get to in a rush.

The more you rush the longer it takes. And for most, they never stop rushing. So, they never get there at all.

Better to be good than lucky.

If you care about who you become, not about what you get for becoming it.
Slow and steady wins the race because they never stop.

On Saturdays sometimes I just wanna go to blockbuster and pick out two movies and two candies.

IYKYK

A mother tells you you’re special.

A father gets you to prove it.

You’re young. You’ve got time.
—>false. 

All this does is extend how long it takes people to realize:

1) Tomorrow isn’t guaranteed
2) Nothing is gonna be easy. Get over it.
3) It takes time to get good.
4) The sooner you start the sooner you get.
5) Don’t stop until you do.

You always think you’re working hard until you see someone working 10x harder than you. Then you’re like “F#%K - I need to work harder.”

The crazy part is that this happens 5-10 times throughout your life.

Which also means - yes - there are people working 1000x harder than you.
If you grow without fixing your problems, you grow your problems.

Rich people buy time. 
Poor people buy stuff. 
Ambitious people buy skills.
Lazy people buy distraction.

Anyone can get rich fast…

…as long as you’re willing to make no money for a long period of time while you work to get good enough to get rich fast.

Being competitive only works if you have a good rival. The best rival being the person you want to be, but aren’t. 

Because he’ll always hand your ass to you.
Just win.
If you want to impress people nowadays, just say what you’re gonna do, then do it.

The lazy don’t know how to start.
The losers don’t know how to finish.
The legends don’t know how to stop

At some point you just have to get over how much work you have to do to get good and how much longer it takes than you think it’s supposed to.

You were lied to.
About what you should expect.
Get over it.
And get to work.

You should learn how to make money while you’re awake before trying to learn how to make it while you sleep.

Crawl. Walk. Run.
Despite what the internet would have you believe, you should learn how to make money before trying to learn how to make your money, make you money.
You don’t need to buy an accountability coach. You need to learn to do what you said you were gonna do.
When you make big life decisions, don’t listen to the people closest to you, listen to the people closest to your goals.
Focus means leaving money on the table.

Every entrepreneur needs to learn the difference between a problem and a missed opportunity.

A problem is something that if not solved, threatens your business. Ex: our payment processor shut us down.

A missed opportunity is when you could do something to make more but you

If workers organize, you call it a labor union.

If businesses organize, you call it a monopoly.

Reminder for salespeople:

If you skirt around issues that customers tend not to like, you’re a coward.

You are lying by omission because you’re afraid of confrontation and setting up your company to look bad because of poorly set expectations.

Find what works. 
Do more of what works.
Find the thing preventing you from doing more of what works. 
Solve it.
Do more of what works.
Repeat.

Somehow other people seem to only have two categories for you once you start making money:

Too rich (he should do more for others)

or 

Not rich enough (he isn’t legit)

And somehow they manage to call you both at the same time without ever getting credit for what you’ve done.
That Snoopy wisdom.

If you’re an entrepreneur, you need to memorize this response:

“That’s an amazing idea. It’s not a priority right now. But I will add it to our big ideas list. Thank you for sharing it.”

Businesses rarely die from a lack of good ideas. They die from a lack of good execution.

My favorite days - as always - unlimited lift days on the weekend.

Reps on reps on reps.

Playlist hits on hits on hits.

When you make a mistake…

A bad partner will tell you what they told you a while ago to remind you how right they were. 

A good partner will tell you what you said a while ago to remind you how right you were.

We need to be reminded more than we need to be taught.

The only person who will give you credit for the work you do that no one sees is reality.

It’s the only thing that will always accurately reflect the work you did.

Because for everyone else, they have to be capable of doing the work you do understand it. Which, they never will.
Don’t judge yourself on the thought you start with but the thought you end with.

Don’t expect to be accepted if you want to be exceptional.

To become exceptional - by definition - you are the exception.

It’s worth being misunderstood.

The alternative is for everyone to totally understand the tradeoffs you chose not to make for a life they don’t wanna have.

Instant 28% revenue boost for small businesses open M-F:

 Be open on weekends. 

You pay payroll on weekends. 
You pay rent on weekends.
Your customers have more time on weekends.
Might as well do business on weekends.
Just. Saying.

(Or don’t. Do you.)

How to get really really ridiculously rich:

1) Learn everything you can about marketing from direct response marketers.

2) Then, forget everything they tell you about everything else.

3) Then learn everything you can about product from software bros.

4) Then use 1 on 3

If you want to beat someone, just try 10x harder than them. You only really need to try 2-3x harder. But you probably don’t realize how much harder they’re trying than you. So try 10x harder - just to make sure you win.
The secret to becoming an overnight success is to advertise for three years straight, keep improving your product, and hire people who love your customers as much as you do.

They will make fun of you for going to the event, listening and taking notes from the podcasts, saving up to buy a course, or help.

And by the time you prove them wrong, you realize their life is proof enough you were right

And you have nothing left to do but keeping doing you.
The better you do, the more people will criticize your tradeoffs because it makes them feel justified about the risks they didn’t take and the work they didn’t do.

Imagine someone criticizes a made up cartoon character. You probably wouldn’t care.

Yet somehow, when people who don’t know you criticize a made up version of you - you get upset.

Getting upset about make believe people getting upset about a make believe you.

Failure. Feedback. Fools.

To succeed, you need to be able to handle the first, take the second, and avoid the third.

My favorite thing to do is a Sunday morning super long lift with nothing pressing on my calendar. 

Followed by brunch with bros.

When you start a business everything is hard & inefficient.

You have: No skills. No money. No friends.

You only have time.

And you have to invest time inefficiently to become efficient. You can’t skip it.

It’s what creates the skill, money & connections that makes it easy.
You can impress anyone by out working them.
Before saying the algorithm changed or that you got shadow banned, consider the more likely alternative that your content might just have sucked.

The cost of ignorance is easy to quantify but hard to comprehend.

The cost of not knowing how to get what you want is the value of the thing you want.

And that education costs time and money.

You pay with the one you value least.
Most people can’t figure out what business to start because they’re not good at anything.

The median lifespan for a U.S. male is 74 years old.

That means you’re middle aged around 37, not 50.

And if you adjust for our decreased perception of time as we age (1/age), we are at the mid point around 20-21.

You don’t have as much time as you think.
Make your move.

The Trump assassination attempt was a month ago.

But, the news has cycled twice over since then.

If one of the most significant events for one of the most important figures in the western world can be forgotten in a month

The world will forget your drama too.

Just wait a week
